title: Improving Fashion Item Encoding and Retrieval
description: To make the properties of a fashion item more accessible, we collect the array information in the catalog and map it into an abstract mathematical linear space, the fashion space. There, the item is represented by a vector, its Fashion DNA. Unlike the catalog data, Fashion DNA is a fundamentally geometrical representation: The similarity between two articles is encoded by their distance in fashion space, while article properties (is it blue? Is it a dress? Is it offered by Nike? Does customer #1,234,567 like it?) are associated with specific directions in this space.
